title: from the longest tunnels to things only train drivers know

Our brand new interactive rail map of Britain is just the ticket for fans of trains.

It will take you on a journey back in time to The Age Of Steam to reveal fascinating facts and trivia about the most famous lines up and down the country.

It covers how they came to be, reveals the eye-watering journey times of yesteryear, explains where the nation's longest tunnels are hidden and lifts the lid on a host of things only drivers would know.

Plus it also features some of the most famous trains ever to chug along the rails, from The Flying Scotsman to Harry Potter's Hogwarts Express.

Our detailed map - compiled with the help of rail expert Phil Marsh - celebrates the launch of new TV show Steam Train Britain, which airs Thursdays at 8pm on Yesterday.

CLICK ON THE LINES BELOW TO LEARN ABOUT EACH ONE

Steam Train Britain shines a light on the steam train heritage lines across Britain which have been re-opened by enthusiasts and are now enjoyed by more than eight million passengers every year.

The show goes behind-the-scenes to check out all sorts of steam engines and speaks to the people who keep their magic alive today.
description: Explore the most popular lines ahead of new TV show Steam Train Britain, which airs at 8pm every Thursday on Yesterday
